meanings.definition: Showing disapproval or contempt towards others perceived as inferior.
meanings.sent1: She always wears the snobbiest clothes to make others feel small.
meanings.sent2: The snobbiest girl in school never talks to anyone she deems unworthy.
meanings.sent3: He acted snobbiest when he found out his friend didn't know the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent4: The snobbiest cat in the neighborhood looks down on all the other pets.
meanings.sent5: The snobbiest attitude at the party made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a superior or condescending manner towards others.
meanings.sent1: The snobbiest customer demanded special treatment at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: She gave the snobbiest smile when she saw her rival trip and fall.
meanings.sent3: He felt snobbiest when he corrected his classmate's pronunciation in front of everyone.
meanings.sent4: The snobbiest bird in the flock refused to share its food with the others.
meanings.sent5: Her snobbiest tone made it clear she thought she was better than everyone else.

meanings.definition: Having an attitude of superiority or exclusivity.
meanings.sent1: The snobbiest club in town only allowed members with prestigious backgrounds.
meanings.sent2: He flaunted his snobbiest possessions to show off his wealth.
meanings.sent3: She felt snobbiest when she received an exclusive invitation to the event.
meanings.sent4: The snobbiest tree in the forest refused to share its shade with the other plants.
meanings.sent5: Their snobbiest behavior alienated them from the rest of the group.
